availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Hattersley (Cincinnati, barkeeper and lieut. 1st ky ind. battery)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, barkeeper and soldier. Native of Sheffield, England. Son of Lydia Hattersley. Resident of Cincinnati in 1850. Barkeeper in Cincinnati in 1860. Teamster in 1861. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as private, sergeant, and lieutenant from June 4, 1861, to March 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 11, p. 265B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 2, p. 141.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0150.
